title: How many pages can you read in 10 minutes? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’ve never kept track. It seems contrary to the spirit of reading. I know people who could read a book in two hours, and ones who could do a sentence in a couple of minutes and then go back and make sure they understood. In his book Ruined City, Nevil Shute places his hero in jail, where he has only a few books and has to learn to read slowly and enjoy them. When I’m reading something interesting and well-written it’s fast, if it’s trash - like a textbook - it’s slow and painful. Think how much better education would be if textbooks were well written, or if teachers used books people liked to read and their students understood. But that’s a different and more interesting topic. I think everyone is like that. There are lots of people in the world who don’t ever read, and it comes down to two causes - they grew up in a house with no books, and parents who didn’t read, or their teachers made them read books and stories nobody could possibly like and made them hate reading and education. Reading is a skill. The more you do it, the faster you get. So really your question is, do you like to read? And that boils down to, do you come from a family with books, and did you have at least one good teacher?

Normally I can read 3 to 4 pages of the book If it's language is easy and normal Like history S&T ( being Engineer) News paper Reading These are easy to read and enjoyable subject. And I'm sure I'll definitely do it. Keep reading. Keep learning. Be happy. Enjoy your life.
